benchmark_details.name: MUREL (MUlticultural Resource for Evaluating Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: MUREL is a curated dataset of 85.2 million tokens spanning six different cultures, developed to facilitate experiments on cultural neuron identification and manipulation in multilingual large language models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To understand and manipulate cultural neurons in multilingual language models for promoting fairness, inclusivity, and alignment.

data.source: Compiled from public sources, covering various cultural dimensions as outlined by Liu et al. (2025).

methodology.calculation: Perplexity changes measured after neuron ablation to assess the impact of cultural and language-specific neurons.
methodology.interpretation: Higher perplexity indicates a greater impact of neuron intervention on model performance.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential misuse could reinforce cultural stereotypes if interventions are misapplied.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data used are derived from publicly available resources; no private information was included.
